titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:07-0400

did.unittitle: Lettre de Thrasibule a Leucipe and Lettre a E...
did.abstract: Two bound manuscripts in French: "Lettre de Thrasibule a Leucipe" and "Lettre a E." The former is credited on the title page to Nicolas Freret (1688-1749), but has been attributed to d'Holbach.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Holbach, Paul Henri Thiry, baron d', 1723-1789

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One volume (Manuscript, 410 pages) is titled "Lettre de Thrasibule a Laucipe. Ouvrage critique historique & Metaphysique par Mr. Freret de L'academie des inscreptiona et belles lettres, mort en 1749, addressee a sa Soeur Religieuse. Dix-huitième siécle." This work, long attributed to Nicolas Frèret, has been proved by Walckenaër to be the joint production of d'Holbach, Naigeon and Lagrange. Cf. Hoefer, v.18, (1858) col. 818. For printed edition of this work see Holbach [Works] vol. 48.
The other volume (Manuscript, 390 pages) is titled "Lettres a E..... - Une bonne morale est l'antidote le plus sur contre la superstition et le fanatisme." A table of contents is in the back.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This manuscript collection falls outside the geographic scope of the Early American guide (British North America and the United States before 1840). It may be of interest to scholars interested in global history, international relations, imperialism, or the U.S. in the world.
